title: Science Knowledge Sharing and Collaborative Projects in Smart Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills and secondary-level foundational science knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners use smartphones as primary learning tools, participate in location-based scientific data collection and collaborative activities. They share science knowledge linked to local environmental issues and apply it to real-life problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can collect and share local scientific data (weather, environmental, etc.) using smart devices (smartphones).
Learners can design science problem-solving projects with peer learners using online collaboration tools.
Learners can explore and utilize personalized and location-based scientific knowledge to propose solutions for real-life problems (e.g., regional climate change).

resources: Scientific data collection apps (e.g., OpenStreetMap, iNaturalist)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
